alert.note: Alert for Blount; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 10:58AM CDT until July 20 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL BLOUNT AND SOUTHERN SEVIER COUNTIES... At 1158 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges continued to indicate showers and thunderstorms producing light to moderate rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the past 3 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area in the next few hours. Flash flooding is ongoing with Cliff Branch flooding now in Gatlinburg and getting into a house on Hemlock Street. Stream and rivers are still rising in the Gatlinburg area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Pittman Center, Elkmont, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Wears Valley and Roundtop Mountain State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
